algs

Class Algorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • algs.Algorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RSIAlg

    public abstract class Algorithm
extends Object
implements Runnable
    The Algorithm class is merely a helpful tool in building your own algorithm. It includes several useful functions that will facillitate TRDR communication and information processing.

    The Algorithm communicates with TRDR through a SocketInterface.

    Think of the Algorithm as an actual part of TRDR where, instead of sending your Message to the MessagingService, you send it to the SocketInterface.

    For example:
    If algorithm "RelativeStrengthIndex" wanted to subscribe to all StockRecords for Google and Apple from TDA 

     String name = "RelativeStrengthIndex";
 HashMap regexes = new HashMap();
 regexes.put("symbol","GOOG|AAPL");
 regexes.put("source","TDA");
 SubscriptionParam param = new SubscriptionParam("StockRecord",regexes,true,name);
 skt.send(new Message("SubscriptionService",param).socketString());

    Future Work I would suggest having a SimpleAlgorithm class that will have all the functions you would need for your most basic of algorithms.

    Author:
    Kyle
    See Also:
    SocketStream
